Full Job Description

IT Technician Intern
Job Title IT Technician, Intern

Location: North Logan, UT

LOCAL CANDIDATES ONLY PLEASE

Status: Part-Time, Internship

Wage: $12.00 - $14.00, DOE

Electric Power Systems (EPS) is an innovative Technology company that supplies Energy Storage Systems to Aerospace & Transportation applications. Our team develops innovative cutting-edge system solutions to address major societal issues by providing sustainable electric propulsion systems. EPS is seeking talent that is drawn to solving new problems, comfortable with thinking out of the box, has a proven history of successful innovation, and enjoys working on a team with like-minded individuals. EPS is building its Electric Propulsion capabilities in Logan Utah and is looking for like-minded individuals to staff its new North Logan, UT, facility.

IT Technician responsibilities

Maintain efficient and optimal internal workflow by resolving technical concerns and difficulties promptly and completely. This requires broad technical knowledge with strong problem-solving capabilities. It also requires the ability to effectively communicate needs and solutions to various departments and groups. Other specific job duties include:

IT Technician skills

 Diagnose and remedy various hardware and software malfunctions.

 Monitor company assets and equipment and ensure compliance to internal standards of traceability, performance, and security.

 Facilitate communication between Engineering Department and IT Department regarding upkeep and organization of file structure system.

 Organize and consolidate company software subscriptions.

 Deploy mobile device management on new and existing company devices.

 Maintain a clean and organized server room.

 Support training of employees on new systems and technology.

 Research and analyze new hardware and software capabilities to integrate into the larger business technology framework.

 Assist IT in any other required duties.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

 Pursuing a technical, associate’s or bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems,

Business Administration, or another related field.

 Relevant experience in IT infrastructure, troubleshooting hardware/software malfunctions.

 Broad knowledge in application software, technologies, and networking systems.

 Ability to quickly absorb information and become a subject matter expert.

 Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

 Strong problem-solving abilities and ability to analyze problems and strategize for better solutions.

 Proven ability to work well independently or on a team.

 U.S. Citizenship or Permanent Resident Alien status is required.

description:
Full Job Description
Location: 20 E. Thomas Road, Phoenix, AZ 85012
Timeline: 10 Weeks, beginning June 7, 2021

We are looking for an Identity and Access Management (IAM) Security Engineering Intern to join the Identity, Access, and Automation team within our Information Security Department. You will participate in a paid program designed to provide you with real-world experience and prepare you for an exciting role in a corporate environment. This internship will help you acquire marketable skills by providing an opportunity to apply your academic knowledge to real-world scenarios.

The successful candidate will be a highly analytical, passionate, and self-driven individual who loves to learn, solve problems, and contribute to the advancement of the team.

Internship Responsibilities:
Gain an understanding of and contribute to the design and implementation of IAM functions, including:
User and system account provisioning
Role-Based Access Control (RBAC)
Auditing and recertification of system access
Privileged Access Management (PAM)
Perform other security-related duties as requested

In order to be a successful intern, you will need to possess the following background/experience:
Scripting and/or programming skills in at least one language/technology, such as C, PowerShell, SQL, Python, or JSON
Fundamental knowledge of authentication and access control methods
Fundamental knowledge of API-driven systems integration and automation concepts
Fundamental knowledge of networking - OSI model
Strong analytical skillset and attention to detail
Ability to research, analyze, and resolve problems
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills
Highly motivated individual with the ability to self-start, prioritize, and multi-task

Targeted Majors: Computer Science, Cyber Security or related field

Minimum Requirements:
Current students with at least 80 hours of completed course work towards Bachelor’s degree
Demonstrated academic success (minimum 3.5 GPA)

Preferred Requirement:
Desire and ability to quickly learn and implement new technologies
Ability to work in Windows (GUI-based) and command line systems, such as Linux Be A Part Of The Team Behind Our Success!
At Advisor Group, we support more than 11,000 financial advisors, the people who help everyday Americans achieve their dreams. We’re a billion-dollar business with the mentality and drive of a startup. Join us in building something special. Equal Opportunity Employer

Advisor Group is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity in our workplace and we hire the most qualified candidates without regard for age, ethnicity, gender, gender identity or expression, language differences, nationality or national origin, family or marital status, physical, mental, and developmental abilities (or the perception of a disability), genetic information, race, religion or belief, sexual orientation, skin color, social or economic class, education, work and behavioral styles, political affiliation, military service, caste, or any other characteristic protected by law.
Eligibility

Applicants for employment in the US must have valid work authorization that does not now and/or will not in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the US by Advisor Group.
Unqualified Applications

Advisor Group does not consider applications from candidates who do not meet the minimum qualifications stated in the job posting.
Recruiting Agencies

Advisor Group only accepts candidates from contracted recruiting firms and only for searches approved prior to submissions. Fees will not be paid for unsolicited submissions.

Job Description

There has never been a better time to join the team at Tenneco! Tenneco is one of the world’s leading designers, manufacturers and marketers of automotive products for original equipment and aftermarket customers. With our product portfolio, dedication to quality, global reach, entrepreneurial setting and competitive strength, we're at a great place to build a lasting career.

Tenneco is seeking a driven, self-motivated Data Engineering focused student who has an interest in gaining hands-on experience working at our fast paced corporate facility located in Southfield, MI.

The Tenneco student program provides a unique opportunity for students to learn, work, and contribute in an industry leading environment. As an intern working at Tenneco, you will be an active member on your team. In addition to being assigned real projects that deliver results, students also participate in networking events, personal development training, and community service opportunities, among other activities that show you what Life at Tenneco is all about!

Possible responsibilities include:
Support marketing teams by automating data curation and providing insights
Document, support, present, and develop existing Python projects in Databricks
Support data engineering projects
Ensure data consistency and accuracy
Gather, analyze, and define project requirements

Required of an Intern:
Must be able to work independently and in a team based environment
Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills

Strong organizational, analytical, and documenting skills

Ability to communicate ideas in both technical and user-friendly language
Excellent problem solving and analytical skills
Effective time management skills
Proficient in Excel, PowerPoint and Word

Experience with Python & SQL

Required Experience

Student currently enrolled and pursuing a Bachelor's Degree from an accredited institution
Student with a minimum overall cumulative GPA of 2.8 or higher
Ability to work at least 40 hours per week during the summer internship period

Student with a minimum overall cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher

Full Job Description

About the role

As member of ML-Tech Algorithms tam, the candidate (1) Analyze complex and advanced NN and to support architecture development (2) Conduct exploration to develop optimized models to support architecture development (3) Develop algorithms including deployment and network optimization to enable running of industry NN on ARM IP.

What will I be accountable for?

Accountabilities include developing new algorithms that can make state-of-the-art deep networks more suitable for resource-constrained Arm hardware , e.g., Arm CPUs/GPUs/NPUs (Neural Processing Units are specialized hardware used for fast processing of Deep Neural Networks)) and Neural Architecture Search where the idea is to find an architecture for deep networks that achieves high accuracy despite incurring low computational costs.

What skills, experience and qualifications do I need?

Pursuing a Masters or PhD in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering or Computer Science
Developing and working with large software systems in programming languages like Python
Knowledge of state-of-the-art deep learning libraries such as Tensorflow and Pytorch
Training large deep learning models on powerful GPU-based systems,
Complex mathematics/statistics for research and development of effective, new algorithms
ML Model Optimization techniques targeted for resource constrained ARM edge compute device.

Arm is an equal opportunity employer, committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal opportunities are available to all applicants and colleagues. We are a diverse organization of dedicated and innovative individuals, and don’t discriminate on the basis of any characteristic.

Assist with generation of County-wide geospatial data and web maps, specifically Public Safety. The primary role of the GIS intern will be field work data collection of addresses and commonplace names. The county will supply a smart phone with a GPS Bluetooth receiver. The intern will need to use their vehicle to drive, with the county reimbursing mileage costs.

Taking into account the pandemic; indoor office time will be avoided. GIS will attempt to setup a VPN connection into the county network or a laptop will be provided.

Approximate hours would be 37.5 hours a week and 500 hours total from May/June to August/September.

This position will be posted until Wednesday March 10, 2021 at 4:30pm.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Applicant must be a Geography, Earth Science, or Computer Science Major with GIS experience.
Must have experience with the ESRI ArcGIS product and knowledge of vector data.
Required skills are GPS, digitizing, database management, geography background/knowledge, with good communication and computer skills.
Preference will be given to seniors.

Preferred applicant will have computer science experience for customizing GIS web applications but not necessary.
Preferred applicant will have experience coding JavaScript, HTML 4 or 5, and document object model, but not necessary

Full Job Description

Corvid Technologies is seeking qualified candidates for an internship working with our Virtual Reality (VR) Visualization Development Group. The VR Visualization Development Group supports Corvid's Structural Mechanics Applications and Aerospace groups to create interactive VR visualizations of Finite Element and Computational Fluid Dynamics simulation results. The group develops data reduction methodologies and creates VR visualization software to view large-memory simulation datasets in a real-time immersive environment.

Examples of Desired Backgrounds: Engineering or Computer Science; background in 3D modeling software and familiarity with 3D geometry file formats; programming experience (Python, C++, C#, Javascript, or similar); knowledge of Unreal Engine 4 or Unity.

Full Job Description

Software Engineering Intern

Peeva is seeking a Software Engineering Intern for this paid internship to permanent hire position. All the fundamentals are in place to help this person succeed: cutting-edge technology and products.

Education - Masters Graduate in Computer Science from an accredited University

The Software Engineering Internship is the prerequisite for a Software Engineering Position. This is a paid internship leading to a potential full-time hire position. Your title will be Software Engineering Intern, however, you will be in a highly visible role reporting to the Company’s CEO, and Chief Technical Advisor. Your performance will have a material impact on the overall corporate success of Peeva’s growth.

In this role, you will be the “bridge” between the high-level company vision and direction and execution of the day-to-day engineering efforts that deliver on the vision. You will learn, grow, and ensure the delivery of our existing software products and work on future product releases if you so choose.

Skills required:

Best practices in Scalable Software Development, Manage unit tests, system tests, and regression tests, estimate work units, work within the swim lanes of our agile development process and how to be part of a team.

Key Responsibilities

Your technical acumen will be utilized from day 1 where you will first be brought up to speed with our existing frameworks, stack, and the overall database design. You will be required and heavily relied upon to trouble shoot, deflect, and altogether prevent any hiccups from occurring. This is actually a fun job with autonomy, established trust, and open minds that seek out creative suggestions.

  • Peeva is a company is here to provide what you make of it, albeit you want to work off Jira Tickets or carve your own niche by contributing within a permanent long term position to assist with the management and motivation of multiple cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality releases on schedule
  • Once you accept our full time offer, you will help grow the engineering staff by hiring quality software engineers that match the culture and that can quickly contribute to our corporate goals, ensure clear and objective communication of goals, responsibilities, and timelines between all stakeholders, both internal and external
  • Formulate and measure long-term objectives and standards of performance for the department and individual engineers
  • Assist in the management of local, remote, and outsourced resources, including hiring and managing, and facilitating the rapid, effective and quality growth and utilization of the engineering staff that interacts with customers to learn about new requirements and opportunities and to articulate the value and best practices of our products

Qualifications

Software product management

  • Experience with enterprise class cloud-based end-user applications targeted at Fortune 1,000 companies is crucial.
  • Proven success in translating business requirements into product
  • Proven success in translating business requirements into product plans
  • Experience with and a commitment to Agile development methodologies
  • Ability to motivate and inspire others through collaboration and influence
  • Strong relationship management, strategy development, project management, problem-solving and change management skills
  • Committed to the highest standards of excellence and integrity

Requirements:

Masters graduate with a keen passion towards Software Development (Application Security, Information Security, Network Security) and Networks.

Technical Skills:

Programming: Java - Core, Spring, and other frameworks | Web Services | Bash | .NET Core 2 or later with C# | Entity Framework | Identity Server 4 | Ionic 4 or later | Microsoft SQL Server Web

| HTML | CSS | JS |

Tools/API : Proficiency in working with Amazon Web Services offered tools.

Networks:

Technologies : | BGP | EIGRP | OSPF | MPLS | TCP | IP |

Security:

Technologies : | TLS | Authentication (OAuth, Kerberos, MAC) |

| Confidentiality ( AES, 3-DES, RSA ) | Integrity ( SHA-1, SHA-2, MD5 ) |

TooI/ API : | nmap | Nessus | Backtrack | Java Crypto Library |

Full Job Description

DVSport, Inc. is a software company based in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania specializing in digital video acquisition, analysis, and playback software designed specifically for the sports market. With over 2,350 systems deployed, DVSport has a strong customer base that spans the professional, intercollegiate and high school sports market. Additionally, DVSport is the industry leader in HD Instant Replay solutions for professional and collegiate sports. DVSport is leading the way in developing innovative digital video solutions at all levels of competition for all sports and delivers proven solutions that have become the standard by which sports-related digital video analysis systems are measured. DVSport customers use their custom-designed software products on a daily basis to scout, analyze, review, and teach.

This technical production internship would be in our corporate production headquarters and will work with our technical production team in a hands on and fast paced environment.

Your Role:

-Work under senior production team members to assist with the development, assembly, support, testing, and deployment of technical equipment and hardware that is used by our clients in the field.

- Assist with inventory management controls and documentation.

- Work with the shipping department on hardware deployment and returns and condition assessments.

What you bring to the game:

-Currently majoring in Computer Science, Information Technology, Computer Engineering, related IT or Engineering discipline preferred.

-Demonstrate working understanding and knowledge of the IT field including but not limited to hardware and software.

-Sharp mathematics skills.

-Working familiarity with electronic components and maintenance of components.

-Capable of working independently as well as with a team.

-Strong and demonstrated leadership abilities.

-Ability to work under and meet deadlines.

-Strong communication skills.

-Commitment to customer service and meeting and exceeding customer expectations.

-Must have a valid driver’s license.

-Ability to lift objects upwards of 50 lbs.

-U.S. Citizenship preferred.

-Availability to work a set schedule throughout the week.

Full Job Description
2021 Summer Intern Product Management
Virtual

The Commercial Real Estate (CRE) industry is at an inflection point. The technological disruptions that have already transformed retail, travel, and transportation have been slower to emerge here, but they are coming at full speed. JLL, a globally recognized leader in CRE, recognized these forces early, and is making massive investments in technology to transform both itself and the industry as a whole.

JLL Technologies (JLLT) is the tech arm of JLL, with the dual mandate of growing the company’s technology revenue while also driving market share and margin gains in our existing business. Our mission is to leverage technology to increase the value and liquidity of the world's buildings, while enhancing the productivity and the happiness of those that occupy them.
We are currently seeking a Summer Intern in Product Management to join our growing team. In this role, you will learn the craft of product management and have the opportunity to lead the definition, development and launch of a high impact feature on one of our key strategic products. JLL has multiple positions open under this Product Management role.

Areas of focus include:
Product market research and analysis

Product strategy

Product case studies

Project/program/portfolio management

Training and demos

Rollout support

Technical writing

What this job involves
As a Summer Intern in Product Management at JLL Technologies, you will:
Conduct user research to scope and define an enhancement to one of our products

Work with our design and engineering teams to develop the feature you recommend

Develop materials and collateral (e.g., email content) to publicize the change

Analyze the resulting data to measure the outcomes of your efforts

Desired skills and experience
Actively pursuing a technically-oriented bachelor’s degree, with 2-3 years completed (e.g., computer science, electrical engineering, mechanical engineering, etc.)

Minimum 1-2 computer science classes completed

Minimum 3.0 GPA

Exceptional verbal and written communication

Experience analyzing data in Excel or another data analysis platform

What you can expect from us
We succeed together—across the desk and around the globe and believe the best inspire the best, so we invest in supporting each other, learning together and celebrating our success.
Our Total Rewards program reflects our commitment to helping you achieve your career ambitions, recognizing your contributions, investing in your well-being and providing competitive benefits and pay. We can’t wait to see where your ambitions take you at JLLT. Apply today!

JLL is committed to creating an inclusive work environment that respects all people for their unique skills, backgrounds and professional experiences. We strive to hire qualified, diverse candidates, and we will provide reasonable accommodations for known disabilities.

JLL is committed to creating a diverse intern program and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status

Full Job Description
About Syngenta
Syngenta is a leading agriculture company helping to improve global food security by enabling millions of farmers to make better use of available resources. Through world class science and innovative crop solutions, our 28,000 people in over 90 countries are working to transform how crops are grown. We are committed to rescuing land from degradation, enhancing biodiversity and revitalizing rural communities.

About this Job:
We believe that that most IT departments witness change, we aim to cause it by discovering and applying new and novel technologies to real world problems. We are looking for curious, determined and high performing individuals who will push hard for breakthroughs that help the company.

As an Intern within the Data Platform team, you will work with a global team to enhance the organizations Data Science capabilities in the AWS Cloud. You will work on a project that will deliver the capability to implement and deploy a secured on-demand Data Science platform using SageMaker, Redshift and associated tools. In addition, the capability will deliver the foundation of our Data Pipelines for servicing the needs of the Data Science community.

At the end of the Internship, the goal is:
To be able to deploy workloads on SageMaker in a secure fashion
To be able to prepare the data from our Data Lakes for ingestion into the SageMaker environment
To design a prototype Amazon SageMaker Pipeline
To ensure the integration of required security measures, like the use of KMS, AWS Secrets Manager and other tools to securely manage the data being used and generated
To Develop the metrics required to measure the effectiveness of the platform (availability, cycle time to deploy, errors)
To Deliver a Training Module that lays out the processes for using these toolsets

Essential Duties & Responsibilities:
Work with the Cloud/Compute, Information Security and Data Science architects to design the environment to meet the requirements
Build test cases and implement security controls needed to ensure end-to-end security of the environment

Duration:
May 2021– August 2021

Qualifications

Education & Experience:
Currently pursuing a degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related field with a graduation date on or after Dec 2021
Strong programming experience with Python or Java, SQL, MEAN stack, HTML5, CSS. Front end development experience using AngularJS or REACT is a plus
Understanding and familiarity with AWS Data Science tools (RedShift, SageMaker, etc.)
Should be knowledgeable about the AWS ecosystem and services

Additional Knowledge, Skills, Traits & Abilities:
A self-starter who is motivated to take ownership of projects and drive task to completion
Passionate about improving users’ experience
Curious about and keeps up to date with current technology industry and developments
Excellent verbal and written communication skills including strong interpersonal skills
Ability to think out of box and come up with innovative solutions
Ability to lead, be self-directed and/or work independently or as part of a team
Highly energetic, committed, and self-driven

What We Offer:
A culture that celebrates diversity & inclusion, promotes professional development, and offers flexible work options to meet both your work and personal needs

Full Job Description

Hello, and thank you for your interest in our Summer Technology Teacher and Assistant Positions! Below is an overview of the program and positions as well as a few questions to help us determine if you are a good fit for our company.

***** APPLY ONLINE https://forms.gle/HcBgnimNwyi7nJVa7 ***************

************************
**JOB DESCRIPTION**
************************

You must be available for 8 weeks this summer from June 8 to August 7. Classes typically run Monday-Thursday with occasional Fridays, and you will need to be available from 8 am to 5 pm. Some classes run in only the morning or just the afternoon, and sometimes both.

As a Teacher or Assistant, you will be driving to your site, typically a school or community education building. You will typically be responsible for bringing 2-3 plastic bins of equipment per class, which you will then be set up in a classroom before students arrive. You will need vehicle to transport class equipment. Our headquarter location is in Roseville, Minnesota. You will need to go every 1 to 3 weeks to our headquarters for training and equipment pick up and drop off.

Rochester and St. Cloud teachers will only need to go twice in one summer

You will be delivering our curriculum to classes of up to 18 students. Teachers must be comfortable with managing up to 12 students alone. Grade level will vary between K-8th grades depending on the class.

************************
ABOUT PROGRAM:
************************
Tech Academy teaches week-long technology classes throughout the US. We offer classes in Minecraft, Movie Making, Video Game Design, Legos, and Robotics for students ages 6-14. We are seeking enthusiastic applicants for our Summer Camp Technology Teacher and Assistant positions.

Ideal applicants for Teacher positions are college students/graduates with experience with elementary-age children or licensed teachers.

Ideal applicants for Assistant positions are tech-savvy high school or college students, or those qualified for the Lead Teacher position looking for a more relaxed role in the classroom.

Many of our past employees were able to use position to satisfy an internship requirement from school.

************************
Training and Equipment:
************************
Before teaching or assisting, teachers must complete 12 hours of online training on basic camp management and leadership skills. You must also complete an in house 12-hour employee orientation.

The curriculum will be provided to each teacher for each class. You are required to go over the curriculum, and submit projects to us prior to teaching. We will available during business hours via phone and email to help you. You will be provided all of the equipment needed to teach a class each week.

************************
Pay:
************************
Teachers: $14-$20 an hour
Assistants $12-$14 an hour
Prep and training: $10 an hour

************************
Requirements:
************************
-College Student/Graduate majoring in Engineering, Computer Science, Graphic or Visual Arts, Video Game Design or Education
-Experience with Elementary age children
-Have a valid driver’s license
-You will be required to complete a local and national background check
-Be very comfortable with technology and using computers
-Your own reliable vehicle that can transport up to 4 large plastic totes
-Able to lift equipment totes weighing up to 40 pounds
-You must be very punctual and reliable. Students must always be supervised.
-You must be organized and efficient to run an effective class
-You must be self-confident, energetic, creative, and assertive enough to control a class of high energy elementary-age kids
-You need to be able to work independently and communicate via email and phone with us on a regular basis
Reliable access to the Internet and a cell phone.

Plusses:
Knowledge of Legos, Minecraft, or both Programming or Robotics experience of any kind

Full Job Description

Job Summary

  • Are you a junior or senior pursuing a bachelors degree and looking for a career in software engineering?
  • Are you studying and living in the Greater Philadelphia Area?
  • Would you like a paying, flexible internship year-round where you'll learn and grow?
  • Do you want to work side-by-side with friendly, experienced engineers then take what you've learned back to crush your classroom projects?
  • Do you want to know you have a great job opportunity before you graduate?
  • Can you start now?

If you're thinking yes to all the above, consider an internship at Precision Systems, Inc.

Precision Systems, Inc. (PSI) has been in the business since 1984, supporting leading companies with proven expertise in developing microprocessor, embedded, PC-based products, and mobile device products. As well as providing software and firmware development services, we specialize in software related consulting and planning. Our clientele includes Fortune 500 companies, the U.S. Government, start-ups, and privately owned businesses. The industries we serve range from the medical and pharmaceutical fields to military equipment and across many commercial concerns. This varied experience provides our clients a diverse array of software development options for their applications and our engineers with new and interesting projects to take on.

PSI is seeking motivated, bright undergraduates to join the organization as Software Engineering Interns. Interns are trained and tested and once they are able to show they're preparedness, they work on real projects under the direct supervision of senior software engineers. Interns also work on internal products and projects for the company. The experience they gain is varied and highly dependent on the skills and responsibility they exhibit. This position is challenging and rewarding, and for the right person can lead to a full time opportunity upon graduation.

Responsibilities and Duties

All interns must study and be tested on PSI's standard operating procedures for software engineering, verification, change control, and configuration management. In addition, all interns must complete two practical projects that are reviewed and critiqued by other software engineers. Only after they have completed these will they be given project work. Project work varies, but it can be documentation generation, unit test creation, programming, test execution, or other project organizational tasks. The exact activities will change from week to week but the nature of the work will always be meaningful.

Qualifications and Skills

Requirements:

  • GPA of 3.5 or higher
  • This position is open only to juniors and seniors pursuing bachelor’s degree in CS, CE, IST, or other similar course of study with a focus on software programming
  • Ability to work at least 20 hours per week, year-round, in our office in Horsham, PA

Ideal Candidate:

  • You have strong communication and questioning skills
  • You have strong problem solving skills
  • You are willing to take on new challenges and tasks that lie outside your comfort zone
  • You have a desire for a long-term employment opportunity
  • You are self-starting and self-regulating
  • You have excellent time management skills
  • You can set a schedule for your availability at the start of each semester and stick to it

Benefits

This position has no additional benefits.

Job Type: Internship

Pay: $15.00 per hour

Experience:

  • applicable college: 2 years (Required)

Work authorization:

  • United States (Required)

Steampunk is seeking a forward-thinking, well-rounded Data Science Analyst intern who will assist with special projects supporting a cross functional team across the business. We are looking for individuals who have a record of outstanding academic performance, high learning agility, and who can work in an open and entrepreneurial way.

Collaborate and innovate to connect our people with the technology they need to build market relevant skills and be impactful to the business.

Knowledge & Skills

Excellent teambuilding and collaboration skills with cross-functional teams

Action-oriented
Attention to detail

Oral and written communication

Through our Human-Centered delivery methodology, we are fundamentally changing the expectations our Federal clients have for true shared accountability in solving their toughest mission challenges. As an employee owned company, we focus on investing in our employees to enable them to do the greatest work of their careers – and rewarding them for outstanding contributions to our growth. If you want to learn more about our story, visit http://www.steampunk.com.

Full Job Description
Symetra has an exciting opportunity to join our team as a Market Intelligence Intern!

About the role

We are currently recruiting for an Intern in Symetra’s Market Intelligence area, with an emphasis on data analysis. This role is focused on supporting the needs of the Retirement Division’s Market Intelligence team and will have the opportunity to interact with Product Development, Product Management, Actuary, Compliance, Marketing and Sales. This is a 12 week, paid, fully remote internship.

At Symetra, we seek to engage and empower every individual. We value collaboration, diversity of thought and experience, sharing ideas, winning as a team and always striving for excellence.

Responsibilities

Review and enhance current reporting processes.
Recommend and create efficiencies and processes for established reporting methods.
Import, clean and prepare data sets in SQL.
Assist Market Intelligence and Sales teams with market and competitive research.
Participate in ad-hoc projects.

What our Interns have to say:
“My internship at Symetra was a meaningful and valuable experience. Not only did I learn more technical skills through working on projects that made real contributions to the team but I also developed relationships with people I worked with who were always more than willing to help, answer questions, or just to chat!”- Sabrina, former intern
Currently pursuing or recently graduated from a 4-year college, or advanced degree, in Actuarial Science, Business, Business Intelligence, Computer Science, Data Management, Data Science, Economics, Finance, Math or Statistics.
Strong computer skills, especially Excel, SQL, Power BI and PowerPoint.
Highly motivated individual, with strong analytical skills, looking for a challenging and fast paced work environment.
Eager to learn about the retirement industry and the role Market Intelligence plays.
Good decision making and problem-solving skills. The ability to be innovative and be creative in resolving issues and improving processes.
Ability to act independently, while also working cross-functionally within the immediate work group.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Critical attention to detail, must be able to prioritize, organize and plan well.
Goal oriented with a track record of driving through to completion.
Ability to work under pressure, juggle multiple tasks and meet deadlines.
Foster a positive and proactive work environment.

In a complex industry, we strive for clarity.

Symetra is a dynamic and growing financial services company with 60 years of experience and customers nationwide. In our daily work delivering retirement, employee benefits, and life insurance products, we're guided by the principles of VALUE, TRANSPARENCY AND SUSTAINABILITY. That means we provide products and services people need at a competitive price, we communicate clearly and honestly so people understand what they're getting, and we build products that stand the test of time. We work hard and do what's right for our customers, communities and employees. Join our team and share in our success as we work toward becoming the next national player in our industry.

Learn more about our careers at www.symetra.com/careers

Opportunity

At Kohler Co., we continually seek motivated Information Technology, IT, associates with high integrity and work ethic; detail-oriented individuals with strong analytical, communication, and leadership skills. Passion, initiative, and a desire for continuous improvement are additional competencies which are essential for success.

As a highly integrated and growth-oriented company, it is a strategic initiative of the IT organization to promote from within the company. Application Programming

Database
Desktop Server Support
Digital Capabilities
Finance Systems
Human Resources & Legal Systems
IT Security

Full Job Description
**Note: Unfortunately, Summer Internships at LendingTree are not open to students who will require sponsorship now or at any point in the future. Thank you.

This position will likely work remotely the entire summer. However, our preference is to hire someone who will be based in the Charlotte, NC area on the chance we're able to go back to office during the summer.

THE POSITION

Our former Summer Interns will tell you, LendingTree’s Internship Program is selective, challenging and structured to push the limits of what they thought they could do - and they wouldn’t have wanted it any other way. Are there easier ways to spend your summer? Absolutely. But a LendingTree Internship will help you grow professionally and also get you closer to landing a phenomenal job once you graduate – maybe even with LendingTree. Here’s what you can expect:

Real work. The only person you’ll be getting coffee for at LendingTree is yourself. You’ll be doing professional level work that will have a real impact on the business
Training. Sure you’ll learn a ton of industry skills as you contribute to your team every day, but you’ll also go through specific training on: crafting a phenomenal resume and LinkedIn profile, getting interviews and how to handle them, how to give a great presentation and more
You’re not alone. In addition from the support from your team you’ll be assigned a Mentor outside of your department who will guide you and mentor you throughout the summer
End of summer presentation. At the end of the summer every Intern gives a PPT presentation to Executives which will include a summary of what you accomplished, what you learned and 2 ideas that will either make the company money or save the company money

RESPONSIBILITIES

Own a project – Analyze current customer experiences. Define, and run A/B tests and optimize consumer web-based product to specific metrics.
Monitor and analyze product performance and communicate findings and recommendations for meaningful changes. Define Product requirements for actionable changes and reiterate.
Put together wireframes to support product requirements and changes to be done.
Understand scope of the internal web-based product, participate in workshops. Own feature delivery, and write product requirements by working with business and development teams.
Communicate to partners on the progress of the feature/functionality.

QUALIFICATIONS

Undergrad or grad student (3.5+ GPA required) who will be graduating in Dec. 2021 or May 2022 (GPA must be listed on your resume to be considered).
Preferred majors: Business, Information Technology, Computer Science.
Proficient in Excel (Pivot Tables, VLOOKUPs, etc.) and SQL
Good understanding of how APIs work.
Knowledge of Agile/Scrum product development or software development methodologies is preferred.
Willingness to roll up your sleeves and GET STUFF DONE.

COMPANY

LendingTree is the nation’s largest online lending marketplace. That means we connect customers with multiple lenders so they find the best deals on loans, credit cards, savings accounts and insurance. Our goal is to help people save money, and we believe the best way to do that is by giving them a way to shop for loans and compare lenders so they make their best financial choices. Our CEO Doug Lebda founded the company in 1996 after a frustrating house-hunting experience. In those days, we mostly helped people find good mortgage deals. Now, we help consumers find their best in personal loans, auto loans, business loans, student loans, credit cards, savings accounts, home equity loans and more.

What else you should know:
We’re a publicly-traded company (TREE).
We’ve welcomed several other companies into the LendingTree family to augment our efforts at helping borrowers make their most sensible financial choices.
We’ve built the LendingTree app and My LendingTree dashboard to give consumers tools to manage and monitor their financial health.
We still make funny commercials.

CULTURE

We’re a fast-paced company with an entrepreneurial bend. We work hard and test our products often. We’re collaborative, ambitious, candid and high-energy. Our teammates are some of the brightest, most talented people you’ll ever work with. We care more about your smarts than we do about the kinds of clothes you wear (but please, do wear clothes to work!), and we’re pretty good about rewarding innovation, creativity and the knack for just getting stuff done (we even have an award for employees called the GSD, “Get Stuff Done”). Come work with us!

LendingTree is the kind of company that not only promotes diversity and inclusion; we thrive because of these values. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion (or creed), gender, gender expression, age, national origin, disability, marital status, sexual orientation or military status.

Full Job Description
Are you ready to join a growing team that puts a premium on productivity and has an award-winning culture, centered around transforming talented employees into effective business leaders?

Then Bankers Healthcare Group is the place for you. We offer innovative financial solutions to licensed and highly-skilled professionals, representing the best of both traditional lending and fintech, and are looking for passionate, impact players to help take our company to the next level.

At BHG, you’ll become immersed in the finance industry—with a variety of loan solutions, credit cards, patient financing, bank programs, and collections services, which have helped BHG become one of the leading providers of finance solutions.

With over 18 years in business, we have the stability of an established company with the speed and agility of a startup, where ingenuity and risk-taking are encouraged, and every employee has the opportunity to learn, grow and thrive.

Who You Are
You are a motivated student pursuing a degree in computer science and are passionate about custom application development. You are driven, logical, and innovative and thrive in a fast-paced environment where you can create custom applications from scratch.
What You'll Do
Create new, innovative Microsoft Azure based solutions following best practices for performance and scalability
Contribute to improvements of ongoing standard software development processes, team infrastructure and methodology in collaboration with other Software Engineers
Ongoing review of development efforts to ensure compliance with business requirements, scalability, security, and other best practices
Maintain web-based applications and back-end services using the C#/.NET Framework, SQL Server and other cloud technologies
Code front-end web pages using modern technologies (React w/ Hooks, Typescript, CSS)
What You'll Need
Pursuing a degree in Computer Science or related technical discipline
Experience as a Microsoft technologies developer, specifically with C#/.NET
Experience building high-performance web user interfaces with frameworks such as Angular, Vue.JS or React
Strong problem-solving skills
Adaptable
Passionate about technology
Teamwork
Life at BHG
At BHG, we work hard and aren’t afraid to take risks. Since the beginning, our core values of PMA (positive mental attitude), team player and loyalty have been the driving force behind every interaction we have between each other and our customers. We have a healthy respect for the daily grind, yet we value work/life balance. We believe that all employees should have the opportunity to lead and that good ideas can come from anyone. From the top-down, our leaders are actively involved not only in strategic oversight and running the business, but also in the wellbeing and growth of all employees. We consider people our #1 asset, and help employees realize their full potential, set and exceed their goals, and explore new opportunities for personal and professional development.

Why You Should Join BHG
We strive to offer amenities, opportunities, events, and programming that support the interests of our teams, while furthering the culture that makes us Great Place to Work® certified. Some of the benefits you can expect when you join BHG include:

  • 100% coverage of monthly health insurance premiums
  • Competitive PTO and vacation policies
  • Company 401(k) plan with employer contributions after one year
  • On-site gym access and memberships, with personal trainers, and certified nutritionists on staff
  • Company-sponsored training and certification opportunities
  • Monthly award ceremonies where top achievers are celebrated and receive additional bonuses
  • Ongoing volunteer opportunities to give back to the community through our BHG Cares program
If you’re ready for a career where you can exercise your passions, be surrounded by co-workers who are relentlessly committed to service, and have a team-player mindset, apply today!

Full Job Description

Senior Firmware Engineer / System Engineer
GeoSensorX platform products include plug and play devices for the enterprise IoT market. The hardware team is responsible for industrial design, electrical engineering, mechanical engineering, supply chain, and manufacturing. This role is a key player for bringing the products to market. GSX is focused on the key creative/design/problem-solving, system specification, and bolster development resources with top JDMs, toolmakers, and suppliers. We are hiring for various experience levels.

Responsibilities:

A Firmware / System Engineer at GeoSensorX owns a project from concept through production. Some key responsibilities include:

  • Evaluate system feature tradeoffs and create the system specifications for developing FW for the target product working with the hardware design teams.
  • Assemble and bring up EVKs, board hacks, or quick-turn code for evaluating concepts and jump-starting firmware development.
  • Take a concept and create FW architecture, and implement drivers, applications with embedded OS either on your own or navigate the process with JDM resources.
  • Collaborate and select critical components to ensure the quality and timely delivery of the product software.
  • Create a test plan for each phase and applications of the product through PVT and characterize the full system for function, power, and use-cases. Validate FW quality through functional verification, power and thermal test, and full system testing
  • Partner with JDM companies to validate, certify and manufacture quality software for the target products.

Skills & Experience Required:

  • BS or MS degree in Computer Science or similar is a plus
  • 5 to 10 years of relevant experience in product development (enterprise or consumer)
  • Excellent C, C++ programming skills with experience in embedded system design and development
  • Experience with wireless communication techniques and associated protocols such as WiFi, BLE, cellular communication (LTE modules)
  • Experience in debugging embedded systems and microcontroller peripherals including I2C/SMB, SPI, UART, ADC, CAN (OBD)
  • Experience with developing project scope and project deliverables from product requirements
  • Experience in product bring up, debugging, and testing
  • Must have excellent verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills
  • Self-starter and work with minimal supervision

We welcome all. All sizes, colors, cultures, sexes, beliefs, religions, ages, people. We depend on the unique approaches of our team members to help us solve complex problems. We are committed to increasing diversity across our team and ensuring that GeoSensorX is a place where people from all backgrounds can contribute and make an impact.

Familiar with big data analytics tools, and conducting large scale analysis

Excellent written and verbal communication skills including experience speaking to both technical and business audiences
Experience engaging with operators (Mobile Network Operators / ISPs / Wholesalers) in emerging markets
Understanding of network metrics, measurements and performance data for mobile and/or fixed line networks
Intent to return to degree programme after the internship/co-op

Virtual

The Commercial Real Estate (CRE) industry is at an inflection point. The technological disruptions that have already transformed retail, travel, and transportation have been slower to emerge here, but they are coming at full speed. JLL, a globally recognized leader in CRE, recognized these forces early, and is making massive investments in technology to transform both itself and the industry as a whole.

JLL Technologies (JLLT) is the tech arm of JLL, with the dual mandate of growing the company’s technology revenue while also driving market share and margin gains in our existing business. Our mission is to leverage technology to increase the value and liquidity of the world's buildings, while enhancing the productivity and the happiness of those that occupy them.
We are currently seeking a Summer Intern - Product Design to join our growing team. In this role, you will learn the craft of product design and have the opportunity to lead the design of a high impact feature on one of our key strategic products.

What this job involves
As a Summer Intern – Product Design at JLL Technologies, you will:
Conduct user research to scope and define an enhancement to one of our products

Work with our product and engineering teams to design a new feature

Develop the assets (wireframes, mockups, icons, etc.) necessary for the engineering team to build the feature

Evaluate your work with end-users and internal stakeholders, to assess the impact of your feature

Desired skills and experience
Currently enrolled in a degree or post-graduate qualification in Graphic Design, Human-Computer Interaction (HCI), Computer Science, or a related field.

A design portfolio that demonstrates an understanding of design principles for the web and/or mobile platforms.

Relevant prior internship work, work experience, or personal project experience outside of the classroom in interaction, graphic or motion design.

Demonstrated proficiency with design tools (e.g. Adobe Photoshop, Sketch, Illustrator, After Effects, Quartz Composer, Framer Studio, Figma etc), and familiarity with front-end engineering and/or working with engineers.

Understanding of user-centered design principles, with the ability to apply brand visual assets in a user interface context

Experience of applying visual treatments to user interfaces

What you can expect from us
We succeed together—across the desk and around the globe and believe the best inspire the best, so we invest in supporting each other, learning together and celebrating our success.
Our Total Rewards program reflects our commitment to helping you achieve your career ambitions, recognizing your contributions, investing in your well-being and providing competitive benefits and pay. We can’t wait to see where your ambitions take you at JLLT. Apply today!

Full Job Description
Want to be at the cutting edge of Research and Development? Join a fast paced, dynamic work environment that allows you to express your technical creativity, learn and apply cutting edge software technologies and work in an environment that enables personal development and growth.

Keysight Technologies is a premier global test and measurement company, focused on creating hardware, firmware and software solutions for the communications, aerospace, automotive and electronics industries.

In the High Frequency Measurements Center of Excellence (HFM CoE) located at the company headquarters in beautiful Santa Rosa, California approximately 50 miles north of San Francisco. At the HFM CoE, we develop world-leading products used to design and test next-generation products in cellular communications, satellite systems, automotive collision avoidance, and other high frequency wireless systems.

You will be working on projects as a member of a team that gathers requirements, analyzes, designs, prototypes, develops and tests software, firmware and mobile applications that will go into current and future Vector Network Analyzer products. You will be working with other engineers to gather customer requirements to create a complete solution.

While part of a team, you will also be working independently on your priorities and tasks. The scope and complexity of your tasks will be based on your existing knowledge and capabilities as well as how fast you can acquire new skills.

Key Job Responsibilities:
  • Design and develop software, firmware or mobile applications for electronic test and measurement products; meet the schedule and scope needs of the project
  • Write unit and system tests for software
  • Participate in design and code reviews

Job Qualifications:
  • Pursuing college degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering or equivalent.
  • The ability to work in a team, with multiple customers/partners and across geographic boundaries
  • Demonstrated analytical and problem solving skills
  • Knowledge of object oriented programming concepts and design
  • Working knowledge of C++

Come invent the future. Join The Display Systems Research (DSR) group at Facebook Reality Labs Research (FRL Research), whose work spans new VR headset concepts, new types of computational displays, complex experimental systems, and AI-driven graphics. Partner with research scientists, mechanical engineers, electrical engineers, and software engineers to build cutting-edge prototypes and create the AR/VR technology that will bring people together across the globe.We welcome PhD students in computer science, optics, electrical engineering, applied physics or similar, with experience in optical design, computational cameras and displays, and diffractive imaging. Our internships are sixteen (16) to twenty four (24) weeks long and we have various start dates throughout the year.
Investigate novel systems and components for sensing and display that achieve high performance through a combination of algorithms and optics
Implement proof-of-concept hardware prototypes that redefine the state-of-the-art in virtual and augmented reality
Collaborate with scientists and engineers from a variety of technical backgrounds through all stages of project development
Publish research results in top-tier journals and at leading international conferences
Currently has or is in the process of obtaining a PhD in the field of Computer Science, Optics, Electrical Engineering, Applied Physics, or a related field
Experience with geometric optics, physical optics, radiometry and detection, including modeling and simulation
2+ years experience with scientific programming languages such as MATLAB, LabVIEW, Python, Mathematica, or similar
Interpersonal skills: cross-group and cross-culture collaboration
Must obtain work authorization in the country of employment at the time of hire and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment
Prior research investigating 3D sensing and displays
2+ years experience with optical design, sequential or non-sequential ray-tracing
2+ years experience with optical instrumentation, emphasizing modeling and hardware prototyping
Proven track record of achieving significant results as demonstrated by first-authored publications in journals or at conferences, etc.
Intent to return to degree-program after the completion of the internship

  • Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/nstemhs
  • Twitter: https://twitter.com/nstemhs
  • LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/national-stem-honor-society
  • YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=juHYDfYtB8Q

This unpaid internship can be fulfilled virtually from anywhere around the globe; currently all in-person opportunities are on hold.

Duration Requirements: Whether the internship is for credit or not, National STEM Honor Society (NSTEM) hires interns for a minimum of 240 total hours with no maximum, and a 4 month (15 hour / week) minimum. We have had interns with us now for as long as two years and are still part of the organization.

NSTEM was in the development stage for 3+ years and went live in 2020 with the goal of opening thousands of Chapters across the nation as quickly as possible! Our mission is to inspire innovation and recognize student excellence From K to CareerTM in the fields of science, technology, engineering, and mathematics - inspiring kids as young as kindergarten to get involved and stay involved in STEM hopefully for the rest of their education and careers !

Please visit our website at www.nstem.org to really understand NSTEM and the benefits of starting an NSTEM Chapter. Also, please take a look at the National STEM Honor Society social media platforms on Twitter, Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn, YouTube, and Pinterest!

Management & Leadership Opportunities: There are many opportunities to take on a leadership position in NSTEM to lead small and large teams on a myriad of projects. We have two main roles, Directors and Project Managers (PM's).

  • Directors lead divisions or departments that consist of projects, PM's and team members.
  • Project Managers lead individual projects and teams of interns and take a more defined role into each individual project. In some instances, new interns are promoted directly to Director or PM roles however in most cases, interns are promoted from within to fulfill these leadership roles.

Two Types of Internships: There are two types of internships that NSTEM offers, Accredited and Volunteer Internships:

  • Volunteer Internship: NSTEM offers a "Volunteer Internship" option in addition to our official internship for academic credit. If an individual is interested in interning with NSTEM but is not tied to formal education, the internship will be classified as a "Volunteer Internship." This option is offered for individuals who are not interested in receiving academic credit but rather the experience at NSTEM.
  • Accredited Internship: NSTEM works with colleges and universities to provide an experience that is directly related to desired learning outcomes and will complete all necessary paperwork. NSTEM provides this accredited opportunity by supporting interns in meeting program requirements and agrees to provide written documentation of work performed, recommendations, and evaluations for interns (according to performance standards). In order to offer an internship that complies with federal labor laws, NSTEM adheres to the following conditions:
  • The intern clearly understands that there is no expectation of compensation; this is an unpaid internship opportunity
  • NSTEM internships provide training similar to that given in an educational environment
  • This internship can be tied to intern's formal education programs by the receipt of academic credit
  • NSTEM internships accommodate intern's academic commitments and provide significant educational benefits
  • The duration of this internship provides beneficial learning for a specified amount of time
  • Intern's work complements, rather than displaces, the work of paid employees
  • Internships are conducted without entitlement to a paid job at the conclusion of the internship

Intern Goals & Learning Objectives: An intern working for the National STEM Honor Society can expect to meet their academic and learning goals, career exploration, and industry knowledge led by a committed staff providing an experience to meet them:

  • Increase knowledge of the industry
  • Grow leadership skills and learning to manage large projects
  • Gain experience in adapting to changing roles and environments
  • Conduct research and practice analytical / quantitative skills
  • Assertively engage at work, conduct research effectively, write and present professionally, and make business decisions
  • Understand and implement the roles and responsibilities of Project Managers, which include:
  • Track team members' schedules, tasks, needs, and interests
  • Gain proficiency with tools such as G Suite, Trello, SmartSheets
  • Provide a constant flow of work for team members
  • Establish and use effective communication channels with team members
  • Treat team members with kindness, understanding and respect
  • Organize project materials to achieve outcomes efficiently
  • Learn to ramp up quickly on new projects
  • Lead by example, which means rolling up your sleeves and diving into the project!

Supervision & Mentoring: All interns working for NSTEM will be mentored and supervised by our staff. Directors and Project Managers offer diverse educational backgrounds and expertise within their respective fields. Staff members provide opportunities for interns to work on projects that align with their learning goals with evaluation and constructive feedback along the way. NSTEM believes that successful internships go hand in hand with enjoyable internships. Staff will personally check-in with you throughout your internship experience and make adjustments as necessary in order to ensure that you achieve your internship goals. Our team is constantly available for interns that work in the office as well as those that work virtually. Staff works with the requirements of colleges and universities in order to provide written feedback according to their specific policies. We work tirelessly to ensure all of our interns get the attention they need in pursuant to their internship goals. Interns also have the opportunity to learn from each other as there is much collaboration between both local and remote interns.

Being a part of the National STEM Honor Society expansion is an outstanding opportunity to grow your business, entrepreneurship, film production, social media, marketing, sales, service, and outreach capabilities while contributing to a team with the deep purpose of inspiring more STEM into the lives of our students, educators, sponsors, partners and advisory council members. Interns are given the opportunity to make strategic decisions and practice active learning and reflective thinking. They work in diverse teams with other interns, either in the office or through virtual connections. Because of the cooperative nature of NSTEM's projects, interns are encouraged to form continuing networking relationships with each other. Team building is supported in order to set interns up to thrive in a collaborative environment. After interning at NSTEM,

-------------------------------------------------

Org Marketing Statement

With annual sales of $14.3 billion in fiscal year 2019, Parker Hannifin is the world's leading diversified manufacturer of motion and control technologies and systems, providing precision-engineered solutions for a wide variety of mobile, industrial and aerospace markets. The company has operations in 50 countries around the world. Parker has increased its annual dividends paid to shareholders for 63 consecutive fiscal years, among the top five longest-running dividend-increase records in the S&P 500 index.

Position Summary

We have two internship openings. As a member of the Internet of Things (IoT) team, the Software Engineering Intern will work with the IoT software engineering team and data analytics solution architects to collect data from products, develop algorithms to analyze time series data from these products, deploy those solutions to the edge and cloud to enable customers to take action to reduce downtime, improve performance and understand the status of their equipment. As a software engineer, the candidate will apply software development principles, agile methodology and data analytics to put information in a way that customers can understand. The responsibilities include development of user interfaces, data access APIs to interface between Parker components on machines to the cloud databases and test automation using up to date tools and technology in an edge and cloud environment.

Responsibilities

  • Develop software for the IoT Azure based web portal - Develop software for the gateway that aggregates signal data and sends to Azure Cloud - Comply to engineering standards with the guidance of senior engineers - Interpret time series data from machines and components to enable customers to reduce downtime, optimize performance and utilization, and to streamline maintenance - Collaborate with product teams to identify key data sources and required sensing, acquisition and compute strategies to deploy those models into real-time edge systems or to the cloud - Develop, code, and deploy algorithms to interpret IoT data—either using big data tools for historical reporting or through time series machine learning for condition monitoring - Implement solutions that combine data from multiple sources into easy to understand alerts, reports and metrics - Able to integrate data to predict and prevent failures - Understand machine control data, interpret sensor data and build optimal control solutions
Qualifications

  • Student pursuing a computer science, computer engineering, data analytics or equivalent bachelor’s degree - Experience in one or more programming languages: Java, Javascript, C++, Python - Strong communication and team work skills - Experience using Jira a plus - Experience working in Azure or similar environment a plus - Experience in predictive modeling a plus - Experience or projects in AI, machine learning or deep learning a plus - Experience or projects in big data tools, such as Spark or Hadoop, a plus - Up to date technical knowledge of data science, including but not limited to: Data provisioning, cleaning, and normalization, large-scale data storage and retrieval, applied statistics a plus - Visualization techniques and tools, such as Power BI, to produce reports, dashboards, metrics, trend data - Positive attitude with passion for growth, can-do approach to obstacles - Able to work flexible hours, working with global development and deployment teams - Able to work in a flexible environment both remote and on site in Elk Grove Village as conditions require

Experience in network simulation with simulation tools, such as NS2/3, Mininet, etc.

Experience in designing and implementing machine learning algorithms and systems.

Full Job Description
Summary of Role:
This position is for summer 2021 Engineering Intern within GLOBALFOUNDRIES Technology Enablement Department located in Malta, NY.
We are looking a highly skilled and motivated Engineering Intern to work on the development of advanced technology nodes, FinFET, FD-SOI and Bulk nodes, within a dynamic team of semiconductor development experts. This position involves activities associated with the defining and implementing Schematic level Electrical Rule checks. These rules will help designers to avoid any design errors; un-intended connectivity resulting in sub optimal or catastrophic chip failures. Once standardized checks are defined these rules need to be implemented in industry standard EDA tool. Selected candidate will work closely with FAB Technology Development, internal design teams, Internal PDK (LVS/ERC) teams to understand and validate Design and define, refine the Rules. This should also help in understand and validate design driven fail modes. The goal of the internship is to define technology independent and reusable electrical rule checks. Selected candidate will be working on advanced technology nodes (12nm/22nm/28nm) and must have detailed understanding of MOSFET designs, layout and circuits.

Essential Responsibilities:
Implement Schematic Electrical Rule checks(ERC) in PERC or SVRF or any industry standard EDA tool
Currently ERC is coded as layout check, this is an opportunity to port these checks to schematic level and add more appropriate checks and enhance the checking methodology.
Define and standardize ERC across advanced node technologies.
Perform all activities in a safe and responsible manner and support all Environmental, Health, Safety & Security requirements and program

Required Qualifications:
Education – Graduating Senior or Junior in Electrical Engineering / Computer Science or other related discipline
Experience – N/A.
Travel – (% of travel required) - None Expected.
Language Fluency – English
Physical Capacity Demands – None

Preferred Qualifications:
Undergraduate - in Electrical Engineering or Computer science or Physics.
Basic understanding of Semiconductor Device physics and computer programming,
Familiarity with EDA tools, schematic design, layout and simulations, scripting languages PERL, Tcl, Shell will be added advantages.

Work for Indiana

Grow your career with the State of Indiana! With more than 50 executive branch agencies, the State of Indiana is a diverse workforce offering employees stimulating and challenging projects across a broad scope of career opportunities. As a State of Indiana employee, you impact the well-being of Indiana’s communities every day.

At the State of Indiana, we don’t just talk about diversity and inclusion – Our goal is to create a welcoming, accessible, and equitable workplace, with a workforce that is representative of the State of Indiana population. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

About the Indiana Office of Technology (IOT):
IOT provides measurable, secure, consistent, reliable enterprise-technology services at cost-effective prices to our partner agencies so they can better serve our mutual customer, the Hoosier taxpayer.

About the Governor's Public Service Summer Internship Program (GPSSIP):

The Governor’s Public Service Summer Internship Program (GPSSIP) is designed to give college students real-world, hands-on experience in their desired field of study to enhance marketability upon graduation. Participation in the program will offer students a multitude of experiences including networking with state employees, resume building and soft skills workshops, agency head panels, and much more.

This is an unpaid summer-long internship.

About the Internship:
This internship is based in the Deployment Room. As part of the IOT’s seat service offering to its partner agencies, a new PC, under warranty is provided every 4 years. The PC Refresh Team manages and coordinates a 4-year rotating schedule that includes all agencies and their PC replacement dates. The intern provides support for the imaging and deployment of PC Hardware.

A Day in the Life:
The essential functions of this role are as follows:
Responsible for imaging new and used PC hardware;
Responsible for updating job orders and checking out PC hardware to IOT techs;
Processes PC returns by scanning and updating PC inventory records;
Updates inventory counts for PC accessories in the Deployment Room;
Packages and sends PC hardware via couriers to Agency Sites throughout the State;
Customer service is also a crucial element for this position.

The job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required of the employee. Other duties, responsibilities and activities may change or be assigned at any time.

What We're Looking For:
The ideal candidate for this internship has an Associate's or Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience

What You'll Need for Success:
Advanced experience, and advanced knowledge of the following: PC-Desktops and Laptops, peripherals, and client/server technology.
Industry recognized certifications such as A+, Network +, or MCSE are a benefit.
Understanding of Internet technologies beneficial. Hands on experience supporting the MicroSoft Office Suite.
Solid verbal and written communication and documentation skills are required.

Supervisory Responsibilities/Direct Reports:
This role does not provide direct supervision to direct reports.

Equal Employment Opportunity:
The State of Indiana is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Come invent the future. Join The Display Systems Research (DSR) group at Facebook Reality Labs Research (FRL Research), whose work spans new VR headset concepts, new types of computational displays, complex experimental systems, and AI-driven graphics. Partner with research scientists, mechanical engineers, electrical engineers, and software engineers to build cutting-edge prototypes and create the AR/VR technology that will bring people together across the globe.We welcome PhD students in computer science, optics, electrical engineering, applied physics or similar, with experience in optical design, computational cameras and displays, and diffractive imaging. Our internships are sixteen (16) to twenty four (24) weeks long and we have various start dates throughout the year.
Investigate novel systems and components for sensing and display that achieve high performance through a combination of algorithms and optics
Implement proof-of-concept hardware prototypes that redefine the state-of-the-art in virtual and augmented reality
Collaborate with scientists and engineers from a variety of technical backgrounds through all stages of project development
Publish research results in top-tier journals and at leading international conferences
Currently has or is in the process of obtaining a PhD in the field of Computer Science, Optics, Electrical Engineering, Applied Physics, or a related field
Experience with geometric optics, physical optics, radiometry and detection, including modeling and simulation
2+ years experience with scientific programming languages such as MATLAB, LabVIEW, Python, Mathematica, or similar
Interpersonal skills: cross-group and cross-culture collaboration
Must obtain work authorization in the country of employment at the time of hire and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment
Prior research investigating 3D sensing and displays
2+ years experience with optical design, sequential or non-sequential ray-tracing
2+ years experience with optical instrumentation, emphasizing modeling and hardware prototyping
Proven track record of achieving significant results as demonstrated by first-authored publications in journals or at conferences, etc.
Intent to return to degree-program after the completion of the internship
